intro: Acinodendron mutabile, commonly known as the variable acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical interest lies in its variable morphology, which makes it a subject of taxonomic study.
